meanings.definition: The study of phenomena as they are experienced by consciousness.
meanings.sent1: In phenomenologies, researchers explore how people experience events.
meanings.sent2: She delved into phenomenologies to understand human perception better.
meanings.sent3: The class on phenomenologies made him think deeply about his own thoughts.
meanings.sent4: Her phenomenologies were like a map of the mind, revealing hidden patterns.
meanings.sent5: The book on phenomenologies painted a vivid picture of subjective experiences.

meanings.definition: The philosophical study of the structures of experience and consciousness.
meanings.sent1: Philosophers often debate the intricacies of phenomenologies.
meanings.sent2: Studying phenomenologies helps us grasp the nature of reality.
meanings.sent3: The quirky professor had a unique take on phenomenologies.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a labyrinth of phenomenologies waiting to be explored.
meanings.sent5: The concept of phenomenologies lingered in her thoughts long after class.

meanings.definition: The systematic study of phenomena and their relationships.
meanings.sent1: Scientists use phenomenologies to analyze natural occurrences.
meanings.sent2: The textbook on phenomenologies explained the principles clearly.
meanings.sent3: The detective approached the case with the precision of phenomenologies.
meanings.sent4: Her understanding of phenomenologies helped her see connections others missed.
meanings.sent5: The research project aimed to uncover the mysteries of phenomenologies.
